pre.question: 1. Where are you taking this questionnaire?
2. In general, would you say your health is?
3. Have you ever driven a car?
4. Do you currently drive?
5. If you gave up driving, was that mainly because of your vision, mainly for some other reason, or because of both your vision and other reasons?

pre.instructions: INSTRUCTIONS: When you answer the question below, think about your vision with the vision correction you normally use, including glasses, contact lenses, a magnifier, or nothing at all.
pre.question: 6. Because of your vision, how much difficulty do you have <u>driving during the daytime in familiar places</u>? Would you say you have:

answers.option: Never drive during the daytime because of vision
Never drive during the daytime for other reasons

pre.question: 7. Because of your vision, how much difficulty do you have driving <u>at night</u>?

answers.option: Never drive at night because of vision
Never drive at night for other reasons

pre.question: 8. Because of your vision, how much difficulty do you have <u>driving in difficult conditions</u>, such as bad weather, during rush hour, on the freeway, or in city traffic?

answers.option: Never drive in these conditions because of vision
Never drive in these conditions for other reasons

pre.question: 9. How much difficulty do you have seeing things off to the side, like cars coming out of driveways or side streets or people coming out of doorways?
10. Because of your vision, how much difficulty do you have with your daily activities?
11. How much difficulty do you have doing work or hobbies that require you to see well up close, such as cooking, fixing things around the house, sewing, using hand tools, or working with a computer?

answers.option: Never try to do these activities because of vision
Never do these activities for other reasons

pre.question: 12. How much difficulty do you have reading ordinary print in newspapers?

answers.option: Never try to do this because of vision
Never try to do this for other reasons

pre.question: 13. How much difficulty do you have reading small print small print in a telephone book, on a medicine bottle, or on legal forms?

answers.option: Never try to do these activities because of vision
Never do these activities for other reasons

pre.question: 14. How much difficulty do you have judging distances, like walking down stairs or parking a car?
15. How much difficulty do you have getting used to the dark when you move from a lighted area into a dark place, like walking into a dark movie theater?
16. How much difficulty do you have seeing because of changes in the clarity of your vision during the course of the day?

answers.option: Donâ€™t have changes in the clarity of my vision

pre.question: 17. How often are you bothered by changes in the clarity of your vision over the course of the day?
18. Have you experienced blurry vision in the last 7 days?
18a. How bothersome has it been?

pre.instructions: The next set of questions will reference the following images and their labels.

INSTRUCTIONS: The next few questions are about double images, which some people call "ghost" or "shadow" images. By double images, we mean seeing a distorted or blurry visual image, such as the images shown below. These images may not represent exactly what you see and your symptoms may be more or less severe than what is shown.

pre.question: 19. In the last 7 days, have you seen any double images?

answers.option: Yes, but ONLY when NOT wearing glasses or contact lenses
Yes, but ONLY when wearing glasses or contact lenses
Yes, when wearing AND when not wearing glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 19a. In the last 7 days, how often have you seen double images when you are wearing your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 19b. In the last 7 days, how often have you seen double images when you are NOT wearing any vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I always use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 20a. In the last 7 days, how bothersome have the double images been when you are wearing your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 20b. In the last 7 days, how bothersome have the double images been when you are NOT wearing any vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I always use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 21a. In the last 7 days, how much difficulty have you had doing your usual activities because you see double images when you are wearing your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses
So much difficulty that I can no longer do some of my usual activities

pre.question: 21b. In the last 7 days, how much difficulty have you had doing your usual activities because you see double images when you are NOT wearing any vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: So much difficulty that I can no longer do some of my usual activities
I always use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 22. When you use your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses) do the double images you see:

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses

pre.instructions: INSTRUCTIONS: The next few questions are about glare. By glare, we mean difficulty seeing well when there are bright lights like headlights or sunlight, such as shown in the images below. These images may not represent exactly what you see and your symptoms may be more or less severe than what is shown.

pre.question: 23. In the last 7 days, have you noticed any glare?

answers.option: Yes, but ONLY when NOT wearing glasses or contact lenses
Yes, but ONLY when wearing glasses or contact lenses
Yes, when wearing AND when not wearing glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 23a. In the last 7 days, how often have you noticed glare when you are wearing your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 23b. In the last 7 days, how often have you noticed glare when you are NOT wearing any vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I always use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 24a. In the last 7 days, how bothersome has the glare been when you are wearing your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 24b. In the last 7 days, how bothersome has the glare been when you are NOT wearing any vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I always use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 25a. In the last 7 days, how much difficulty have you had doing your usual activities because you noticed glare when you are wearing your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses
So much difficulty that I can no longer do some of my usual activities

pre.question: 25b. In the last 7 days, how much difficulty have you had doing your usual activities because you noticed glare when you are NOT wearing any vision correction (glasses or contact lenses)?

answers.option: So much difficulty that I can no longer do some of my usual activities
I always use glasses or contact lenses

pre.question: 26. When you use your best vision correction (glasses or contact lenses) does the glare you notice:

answers.option: I do not use glasses or contact lenses

pre.instructions: INSTRUCTIONS: The next few questions are about halos. By halos, we mean seeing a fuzzy cloud of light around lighted objects, such as the ones shown in the images below. answers.option: So much difficulty that I can no longer do some of my usual activities

post.question: 35. In general, how satisfied or dissatisfied are you with your present vision?
36. Currently, how satisfied or dissatisfied are you with the result of your LASIK surgery?
37. Currently, how satisfied or dissatisfied are you with how long it took to see <u>improvement in your vision</u> after LASIK surgery?

answers.option: Never had any improvement in my vision after LASIK surgery

post.question: 38. Currently, how satisfied or dissatisfied are you with how long it took to <u>see improvement in your post-operative symptoms of discomfort</u> after LASIK surgery?

answers.option: Never had any post-operative symptoms of discomfort after LASIK surgery

post.question: 39. When you are <u>not wearing</u> glasses or contact lenses, is your distance vision now as good as you anticipated it would be after LASIK surgery?
40. Are you currently wearing glasses or contact lenses to see things in the distance?
41. When you are <u>not wearing</u> glasses or contact lenses, is your intermediate vision (1.5 to 5 feet away) now as good as you anticipated it would be after LASIK surgery?
42. Are you currently wearing glasses or contact lenses to see things at an intermediate distance (1.5 to 5 feet away)?
43. When you are <u>not wearing</u> glasses or contact lenses, is your near vision (less than 1.5 feet away) now as good as you anticipated it would be after LASIK surgery?
44. Are you currently wearing glasses or contact lenses to see things at a near distance (less than 1.5 feet away)?
45. Did you achieve the goals you had for LASIK surgery?
46. How happy or unhappy are you that you had LASIK surgery?
